intro: Cymbalaria microcalyx subsp. heterosepala, commonly known as the narrowleaf figwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. The plant features opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are clustered in racemes and are characterized by their tubular shape and two-lipped structure, typical of the Scrophulariaceae family. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
